posts.title: His mother had always taught him
posts.body: His mother had always taught him not to ever think of himself as better than others. He'd tried to live by this motto. He never looked down on those who were less fortunate or who had less money than him. But the stupidity of the group of people he was talking to made him change his mind.

comments.body: You are a symbol of beauty.

posts.title: He was an expert but not in a discipline
posts.body: He was an expert but not in a discipline that anyone could fully appreciate. He knew how to hold the cone just right so that the soft server ice-cream fell into it at the precise angle to form a perfect cone each and every time. It had taken years to perfect and he could now do it without even putting any thought behind it.

comments.body: What did I just see, that's amazing, oh sorry it's you!

posts.title: Dave watched as the forest burned up on the hill.
posts.body: Dave watched as the forest burned up on the hill, only a few miles from her house. The car had been hastily packed and Marta was inside trying to round up the last of the pets. Dave went through his mental list of the most important papers and documents that they couldn't leave behind. He scolded himself for not having prepared these better in advance and hoped that he had remembered everything that was needed. He continued to wait for Marta to appear with the pets, but she still was nowhere to be seen.

posts.title: All he wanted was a candy bar.
posts.body: All he wanted was a candy bar. It didn't seem like a difficult request to comprehend, but the clerk remained frozen and didn't seem to want to honor the request. It might have had something to do with the gun pointed at his face.

posts.title: Hopes and dreams were dashed that day.
posts.body: Hopes and dreams were dashed that day. It should have been expected, but it still came as a shock. The warning signs had been ignored in favor of the possibility, however remote, that it could actually happen. That possibility had grown from hope to an undeniable belief it must be destiny. That was until it wasn't and the hopes and dreams came crashing down.

posts.title: Dave wasn't exactly sure how he had ended up
posts.body: Dave wasn't exactly sure how he had ended up in this predicament. He ran through all the events that had lead to this current situation and it still didn't make sense. He wanted to spend some time to try and make sense of it all, but he had higher priorities at the moment. The first was how to get out of his current situation of being naked in a tree with snow falling all around and no way for him to get down.

posts.title: This is important to remember.
posts.body: This is important to remember. Love isn't like pie. You don't need to divide it among all your friends and loved ones. No matter how much love you give, you can always give more. It doesn't run out, so don't try to hold back giving it as if it may one day run out. Give it freely and as much as you want.

posts.title: One can cook on and with an open fire.
posts.body: One can cook on and with an open fire. These are some of the ways to cook with fire outside. Cooking meat using a spit is a great way to evenly cook meat. In order to keep meat from burning, it's best to slowly rotate it.

posts.title: There are different types of secrets.
posts.body: There are different types of secrets. She had held onto plenty of them during her life, but this one was different. She found herself holding onto the worst type. It was the type of secret that could gnaw away at your insides if you didn't tell someone about it, but it could end up getting you killed if you did.

comments.body: I've heard about seven wonders of the world and the 8th just showed up!!

posts.title: They rushed out the door.
posts.body: They rushed out the door, grabbing anything and everything they could think of they might need. There was no time to double-check to make sure they weren't leaving something important behind. Everything was thrown into the car and they sped off. Thirty minutes later they were safe and that was when it dawned on them that they had forgotten the most important thing of all.

posts.title: It wasn't quite yet time to panic.
posts.body: It wasn't quite yet time to panic. There was still time to salvage the situation. At least that is what she was telling himself. The reality was that it was time to panic and there wasn't time to salvage the situation, but he continued to delude himself into believing there was.

comments.body: The stars, the moon, and the sun are minor to me since you sparkle brighter than all of them.

posts.title: She was aware that things could go wrong.
posts.body: She was aware that things could go wrong. In fact, she had trained her entire life in anticipation that things would go wrong one day. She had quiet confidence as she started to see that this was the day that all her training would be worthwhile and useful. At this point, she had no idea just how wrong everything would go that day.

comments.body: I think this is the best I've seen till now.
This picture looks stunning, where did you get it from?

posts.title: She wanted rainbow hair.
posts.body: She wanted rainbow hair. That's what she told the hairdresser. It should be deep rainbow colors, too. She wasn't interested in pastel rainbow hair. She wanted it deep and vibrant so there was no doubt that she had done this on purpose.

comments.body: The control of excellence lies inside the soul.

posts.title: The paper was blank.
posts.body: The paper was blank. It shouldn't have been. There should have been writing on the paper, at least a paragraph if not more. The fact that the writing wasn't there was frustrating. Actually, it was even more than frustrating. It was downright distressing.

comments.body: I love how expressive your eyes are.

posts.title: The trees, therefore, must be such old
posts.body: The trees, therefore, must be such old and primitive techniques that they thought nothing of them, deeming them so inconsequential that even savages like us would know of them and not be suspicious. At that, they probably didn't have too much time after they detected us orbiting and intending to land. And if that were true, there could be only one place where their civilization was hidden.

posts.title: There was only one way to do things in the Statton house.
posts.body: There was only one way to do things in the Statton house. That one way was to do exactly what the father, Charlie, demanded. He made the decisions and everyone else followed without question. That was until today.

posts.title: She was in a hurry.
posts.body: She was in a hurry. Not the standard hurry when you're in a rush to get someplace, but a frantic hurry. The type of hurry where a few seconds could mean life or death. She raced down the road ignoring speed limits and weaving between cars. She was only a few minutes away when traffic came to a dead standstill on the road ahead.

comments.body: The word pretty is worthless without you.
You look beautiful in that dress.
I have got to save this.

posts.title: She had a terrible habit o comparing her life to others
posts.body: She had a terrible habit o comparing her life to others. She realized that their life experiences were completely different than her own and that she saw only what they wanted her to see, but that didn't matter. She still compared herself and yearned for what she thought they had and she didn't.

comments.body: Beauty is control; a grin is its sword.

posts.title: The rain and wind abruptly stopped.
posts.body: The rain and wind abruptly stopped, but the sky still had the gray swirls of storms in the distance. Dave knew this feeling all too well. The calm before the storm. He only had a limited amount of time before all Hell broke loose, but he stopped to admire the calmness. Maybe it would be different this time, he thought, with the knowledge deep within that it wouldn't.

posts.title: He couldn't remember exactly where he had read it
posts.body: He couldn't remember exactly where he had read it, but he was sure that he had. The fact that she didn't believe him was quite frustrating as he began to search the Internet to find the article. It wasn't as if it was something that seemed impossible. Yet she insisted on always seeing the source whenever he stated a fact.

posts.title: He wandered down the stairs and into the basement
posts.body: He wandered down the stairs and into the basement. The damp, musty smell of un-use hung in the air. A single, small window let in a glimmer of light, but this simply made the shadows in the basement deeper. He inhaled deeply and looked around at a mess that had been accumulating for over 25 years. He was positive that this was the place he wanted to live.

comments.body: You're in my mind regularly, and you've certainly taken a place in my heart.

posts.title: She has seen this scene before.
posts.body: She has seen this scene before. It had come to her in dreams many times before. She had to pinch herself to make sure it wasn't a dream again. As her fingers squeezed against her arm, she felt the pain. It was this pain that immediately woke her up.

posts.title: It's an unfortunate reality that we don't teach people how to make money
posts.body: It's an unfortunate reality that we don't teach people how to make money (beyond getting a 9 to 5 job) as part of our education system. The truth is there are a lot of different, legitimate ways to make money. That doesn't mean they are easy and that you won't have to work hard to succeed, but it does mean that if you're willing to open your mind a bit you don't have to be stuck in an office from 9 to 5 for the next fifty years o your life.

posts.title: The robot clicked disapprovingly.
posts.body: The robot clicked disapprovingly, gurgled briefly inside its cubical interior and extruded a pony glass of brownish liquid. "Sir, you will undoubtedly end up in a drunkard's grave, dead of hepatic cirrhosis," it informed me virtuously as it returned my ID card. I glared as I pushed the glass across the table.

posts.title: It went through such rapid contortions
posts.body: It went through such rapid contortions that the little bear was forced to change his hold on it so many times he became confused in the darkness, and could not, for the life of him, tell whether he held the sheep right side up, or upside down. But that point was decided for him a moment later by the animal itself, who, with a sudden twist, jabbed its horns so hard into his lowest ribs that he gave a grunt of anger and disgust.

posts.title: She patiently waited for his number to be called.
posts.body: She patiently waited for his number to be called. She had no desire to be there, but her mom had insisted that she go. She's resisted at first, but over time she realized it was simply easier to appease her and go. Mom tended to be that way. She would keep insisting until you wore down and did what she wanted. So, here she sat, patiently waiting for her number to be called.

comments.body: I love how motivated you are!
Beauty lies inside for those who choose to see.

posts.title: Ten more steps.
posts.body: If he could take ten more steps it would be over, but his legs wouldn't move. He tried to will them to work, but they wouldn't listen to his brain. Ten more steps and it would be over but it didn't appear he would be able to do it.

comments.body: I'm so bored at work, come and rescue me.

posts.title: He had three simple rules by which he lived.
posts.body: He had three simple rules by which he lived. The first was to never eat blue food. There was nothing in nature that was edible that was blue. People often asked about blueberries, but everyone knows those are actually purple. He understood it was one of the stranger rules to live by, but it had served him well thus far in the 50+ years of his life.

posts.title: The chair sat in the corner where it had been
posts.body: The chair sat in the corner where it had been for over 25 years. The only difference was there was someone actually sitting in it. How long had it been since someone had done that? Ten years or more he imagined. Yet there was no denying the presence in the chair now.

posts.title: Things aren't going well at all
posts.body: Things aren't going well at all with mom today. She is just a limp noodle and wants to sleep all the time. I sure hope that things get better soon.

comments.body: You're too short, just like your brain.

posts.title: It was just a burger.
posts.body: It was just a burger. Why couldn't she understand that? She knew he'd completely changed his life around her eating habits, so why couldn't she give him a break this one time? She wasn't even supposed to have found out. Yes, he had promised her and yes, he had broken that promise, but still in his mind, all it had been was just a burger.

comments.body: Wow! You have improved so much!

posts.title: He swung back the fishing pole and cast the line
posts.body: He swung back the fishing pole and cast the line which ell 25 feet away into the river. The lure landed in the perfect spot and he was sure he would soon get a bite. He never expected that the bite would come from behind in the form of a bear.

posts.title: He lifted the bottle to his lips and took a sip
posts.body: He lifted the bottle to his lips and took a sip of the drink. He had tasted this before, but he couldn't quite remember the time and place it had happened. He desperately searched his mind trying to locate and remember where he had tasted this when the bicycle ran over his foot.

posts.title: Debbie had taken George for granted
posts.body: Debbie had taken George for granted for more than fifteen years now. He wasn't sure what exactly had made him choose this time and place to address the issue, but he decided that now was the time. He looked straight into her eyes and just as she was about to speak, turned away and walked out the door.

posts.title: She sat deep in thought.
posts.body: She sat deep in thought. The next word that came out o her mouth would likely be the most important word of her life. It had to be exact with no possibility of being misinterpreted. She was ready. She looked deeply into his eyes and said, "Octopus."

posts.title: The leather jacked showed the scars
posts.body: The leather jacked showed the scars of being his favorite for years. It wore those scars with pride, feeling that they enhanced his presence rather than diminishing it. The scars gave it character and had not overwhelmed to the point that it had become ratty. The jacket was in its prime and it knew it.

comments.body: Beauty is just one of the beautiful features you have.

posts.title: There was no time.
posts.body: There was no time. He ran out of the door without half the stuff he needed for work, but it didn't matter. He was late and if he didn't make this meeting on time, someone's life may be in danger.

comments.body: Behind those beautiful eyes lies a beautiful story.

posts.title: He collected the plastic trash on a daily basis.
posts.body: He collected the plastic trash on a daily basis. It never seemed to end. Even if he cleaned the entire beach, more plastic would cover it the next day after the tide had come in. Although it was a futile effort that would never be done, he continued to pick up the trash each day.

posts.title: It was so great to hear from you today
posts.body: "It was so great to hear from you today and it was such weird timing," he said. "This is going to sound funny and a little strange, but you were in a dream I had just a couple of days ago. I'd love to get together and tell you about it if you're up for a cup of coffee," he continued, laying the trap he'd been planning for years.

comments.body: Hello, you seem truly charming in this as always.

posts.title: Have you ever wondered about toes?
posts.body: Why 10 toes and not 12. Why are some bigger than others? Some people can use their toes to pick up things while others can barely move them on command. Some toes are nice to look at while others are definitely not something you want to look at. Toes can be stubbed and make us scream. Toes help us balance and walk. 10 toes are just something to ponder.

comments.body: The most stunning thing I've seen today.

posts.title: His parents continued to question him.
posts.body: He didn't know what to say to them since they refused to believe the truth. He explained again and again, and they dismissed his explanation as a figment of his imagination. There was no way that grandpa, who had been dead for five years, could have told him where the treasure had been hidden. Of course, it didn't help that grandpa was roaring with laughter in the chair next to him as he tried to explain once again how he'd found it.

posts.title: You know that tingly feeling you get on the back of your neck sometimes?
posts.body: You know that tingly feeling you get on the back of your neck sometimes? I just got that feeling when talking with her. You know I don't believe in sixth senses, but there is something not right with her. I don't know how I know, but I just do.

comments.body: Your beauty is one of the things I like about you.
You are the light in the darkness.

posts.title: Explain to me again why I shouldn't cheat?
posts.body: "Explain to me again why I shouldn't cheat?" he asked. "All the others do and nobody ever gets punished for doing so. I should go about being happy losing to cheaters because I know that I don't? That's what you're telling me?"

posts.title: A long black shadow slid across the pavement
posts.body: A long black shadow slid across the pavement near their feet and the five Venusians, very much startled, looked overhead. They were barely in time to see the huge gray form of the carnivore before it vanished behind a sign atop a nearby building which bore the mystifying information "Pepsi-Cola."

comments.body: You're an incredibly stunning, a really pretty, beautiful woman.

posts.title: The red line moved across the page.
posts.body: The red line moved across the page. With each millimeter it advanced forward, something changed in the room. The actual change taking place was difficult to perceive, but the change was real. The red line continued relentlessly across the page and the room would never be the same.

posts.title: The clowns had taken over. And yes, they were literally clowns.
posts.body: The clowns had taken over. And yes, they were literally clowns. Over 100 had appeared out of a small VW bug that had been driven up to the bank. Now they were all inside and had taken it over.

comments.body: What terrific math skills you're showing!

posts.title: The shoes had been there for as long as anyone could remember.
posts.body: The shoes had been there for as long as anyone could remember. In fact, it was difficult for anyone to come up with a date they had first appeared. It had seemed they'd always been there and yet they seemed so out of place. Why nobody had removed them was a question that had been asked time and again, but while they all thought it, nobody had ever found the energy to actually do it.

posts.title: Trees. It was something about the trees.
posts.body: Trees. It was something about the trees. The way they swayed with the wind in unison. The way they shaded the area around them. The sounds of their leaves in the wind and the creaks from the branches as they sway, The trees were making a statement that I just couldn't understand.

posts.title: Sometimes it's just better not to be seen.
posts.body: Sometimes it's just better not to be seen. That's how Harry had always lived his life. He prided himself as being the fly on the wall and the fae that blended into the crowd. That's why he was so shocked that she noticed him.

comments.body: I can tell this is your best effort!

posts.title: It was a concerning development that he couldn't get out of his mind.
posts.body: He'd had many friends throughout his early years and had fond memories of playing with them, but he couldn't understand how it had all stopped. There was some point as he grew up that he played with each of his friends for the very last time, and he had no idea that it would be the last.

comments.body: Each time I see you, I get light from your eyes.

posts.title: The towels had been hanging from the rod for years.
posts.body: The towels had been hanging from the rod for years. They were stained and worn, and quite frankly, just plain ugly. Debra didn't want to touch them but she really didn't have a choice. It was important for her to see what was living within them.

comments.body: Well I think this is often my favorite posture of yours.

posts.title: The headache wouldn't go away.
posts.body: The headache wouldn't go away. She's taken medicine but even that didn't help. The monstrous throbbing in her head continued. She had this happen to her only once before in her life and she realized that only one thing could be happening.

comments.body: Here's to hope your day consists of bright traffic lights, the supermarket's quickest queue, and all the best ways to get you right back in my embrace.

posts.title: The young man wanted a role model.
posts.body: The young man wanted a role model. He looked long and hard in his youth, but that role model never materialized. His only choice was to embrace all the people in his life he didn't want to be like.

posts.title: Debbie knew she was being selfish
posts.body: Debbie knew she was being selfish and unreasonable. She understood why the others in the room were angry and frustrated with her and the way she was acting. In her eyes, it didn't really matter how they felt because she simply didn't care.

posts.title: She tried to explain that love wasn't like pie.
posts.body: She tried to explain that love wasn't like pie. There wasn't a set number of slices to be given out. There wasn't less to be given to one person if you wanted to give more to another. That after a set amount was given out it would all disappear. She tried to explain this, but it fell on deaf ears.

comments.body: I can tell you've been paying attention!
You look even more pretty without makeup.
You are true, beautiful and pure.

posts.title: The house was located at the top of the hill
posts.body: The house was located at the top of the hill at the end of a winding road. It wasn't obvious that the house was there, but everyone in town knew that it existed. They were just all too afraid to ever go and see it in person.

posts.title: It seemed like it should have been so simple.
posts.body: It seemed like it should have been so simple. There was nothing inherently difficult with getting the project done. It was simple and straightforward enough that even a child should have been able to complete it on time, but that wasn't the case. The deadline had arrived and the project remained unfinished.

comments.body: Your smile is fair enchanted and magnificent.
For a few reasons each cherish tune makes me think of you….

posts.title: Balloons are pretty and come in different colors
posts.body: Balloons are pretty and come in different colors, different shapes, different sizes, and they can even adjust sizes as needed. But don't make them too big or they might just pop, and then bye-bye balloon. It'll be gone and lost for the rest of mankind. They can serve a variety of purposes, from decorating to water balloon wars. You just have to use your head to think a little bit about what to do with them.

comments.body: You've made a lot of progress!
I get attracted to you when you try to make me a better person.

posts.title: She looked at her student wondering if she could ever get through.
posts.body: She looked at her student wondering if she could ever get through. "You need to learn to think for yourself," she wanted to tell him. "Your friends are holding you back and bringing you down." But she didn't because she knew his friends were all that he had and even if that meant a life of misery, he would never give them up.

posts.title: He heard the crack echo in the late afternoon about a mile away.
posts.body: He heard the crack echo in the late afternoon about a mile away. His heart started racing and he bolted into a full sprint. "It wasn't a gunshot, it wasn't a gunshot," he repeated under his breathlessness as he continued to sprint.

posts_with_comments.body: His mother had always taught him not to ever think of himself as better than others. He'd tried to live by this motto. He never looked down on those who were less fortunate or who had less money than him. But the stupidity of the group of people he was talking to made him change his mind.

She had quiet confidence as she started to see that this was the day that all her training would be worthwhile and useful. At this point, she had no idea just how wrong everything would go that day.

This picture looks stunning, where did you get it from?

Yet she insisted on always seeing the source whenever he stated a fact.

posts_with_comments.title: He wandered down the stairs and into the basement
posts_with_comments.body: He wandered down the stairs and into the basement. The damp, musty smell of un-use hung in the air. A single, small window let in a glimmer of light, but this simply made the shadows in the basement deeper. He inhaled deeply and looked around at a mess that had been accumulating for over 25 years. He was positive that this was the place he wanted to live.

comments.body: You're in my mind regularly, and you've certainly taken a place in my heart.

posts_with_comments.title: She has seen this scene before.
posts_with_comments.body: She has seen this scene before. It had come to her in dreams many times before. She had to pinch herself to make sure it wasn't a dream again. As her fingers squeezed against her arm, she felt the pain. It was this pain that immediately woke her up.

posts_with_comments.title: It's an unfortunate reality that we don't teach people how to make money
posts_with_comments.body: It's an unfortunate reality that we don't teach people how to make money (beyond getting a 9 to 5 job) as part of our education system. The truth is there are a lot of different, legitimate ways to make money. That doesn't mean they are easy and that you won't have to work hard to succeed, but it does mean that if you're willing to open your mind a bit you don't have to be stuck in an office from 9 to 5 for the next fifty years o your life.

posts_with_comments.title: The robot clicked disapprovingly.
posts_with_comments.body: The robot clicked disapprovingly, gurgled briefly inside its cubical interior and extruded a pony glass of brownish liquid. "Sir, you will undoubtedly end up in a drunkard's grave, dead of hepatic cirrhosis," it informed me virtuously as it returned my ID card. I glared as I pushed the glass across the table.

posts_with_comments.title: It went through such rapid contortions
posts_with_comments.body: It went through such rapid contortions that the little bear was forced to change his hold on it so many times he became confused in the darkness, and could not, for the life of him, tell whether he held the sheep right side up, or upside down. But that point was decided for him a moment later by the animal itself, who, with a sudden twist, jabbed its horns so hard into his lowest ribs that he gave a grunt of anger and disgust.

posts_with_comments.title: She patiently waited for his number to be called.
posts_with_comments.body: She patiently waited for his number to be called. She had no desire to be there, but her mom had insisted that she go. She's resisted at first, but over time she realized it was simply easier to appease her and go. Mom tended to be that way. She would keep insisting until you wore down and did what she wanted. So, here she sat, patiently waiting for her number to be called.

comments.body: I love how motivated you are!
Beauty lies inside for those who choose to see.

posts_with_comments.title: Ten more steps.
posts_with_comments.body: If he could take ten more steps it would be over, but his legs wouldn't move. He tried to will them to work, but they wouldn't listen to his brain. Ten more steps and it would be over but it didn't appear he would be able to do it.

comments.body: I'm so bored at work, come and rescue me.

posts_with_comments.title: He had three simple rules by which he lived.
posts_with_comments.body: He had three simple rules by which he lived. The first was to never eat blue food. There was nothing in nature that was edible that was blue. People often asked about blueberries, but everyone knows those are actually purple. He understood it was one of the stranger rules to live by, but it had served him well thus far in the 50+ years of his life.

posts_with_comments.title: The chair sat in the corner where it had been
posts_with_comments.body: The chair sat in the corner where it had been for over 25 years. The only difference was there was someone actually sitting in it. How long had it been since someone had done that? Ten years or more he imagined. Yet there was no denying the presence in the chair now.

posts_with_comments.title: Things aren't going well at all
posts_with_comments.body: Things aren't going well at all with mom today. She is just a limp noodle and wants to sleep all the time. I sure hope that things get better soon.

comments.body: You're too short, just like your brain.

posts_with_comments.title: It was just a burger.
posts_with_comments.body: It was just a burger. Why couldn't she understand that? She knew he'd completely changed his life around her eating habits, so why couldn't she give him a break this one time? She wasn't even supposed to have found out. Yes, he had promised her and yes, he had broken that promise, but still in his mind, all it had been was just a burger.

comments.body: Wow! You have improved so much!

posts_with_comments.title: He swung back the fishing pole and cast the line
posts_with_comments.body: He swung back the fishing pole and cast the line which ell 25 feet away into the river. The lure landed in the perfect spot and he was sure he would soon get a bite. He never expected that the bite would come from behind in the form of a bear.

posts_with_comments.title: He lifted the bottle to his lips and took a sip
posts_with_comments.body: He lifted the bottle to his lips and took a sip of the drink. He had tasted this before, but he couldn't quite remember the time and place it had happened. He desperately searched his mind trying to locate and remember where he had tasted this when the bicycle ran over his foot.

posts_with_comments.title: Debbie had taken George for granted
posts_with_comments.body: Debbie had taken George for granted for more than fifteen years now. He wasn't sure what exactly had made him choose this time and place to address the issue, but he decided that now was the time. He looked straight into her eyes and just as she was about to speak, turned away and walked out the door.

posts_with_comments.title: She sat deep in thought.
posts_with_comments.body: She sat deep in thought. The next word that came out o her mouth would likely be the most important word of her life. It had to be exact with no possibility of being misinterpreted. She was ready. She looked deeply into his eyes and said, "Octopus."

posts_with_comments.title: The leather jacked showed the scars
posts_with_comments.body: The leather jacked showed the scars of being his favorite for years. It wore those scars with pride, feeling that they enhanced his presence rather than diminishing it. The scars gave it character and had not overwhelmed to the point that it had become ratty. The jacket was in its prime and it knew it.

comments.body: Beauty is just one of the beautiful features you have.

posts_with_comments.title: There was no time.
posts_with_comments.body: There was no time. He ran out of the door without half the stuff he needed for work, but it didn't matter. He was late and if he didn't make this meeting on time, someone's life may be in danger.

comments.body: Behind those beautiful eyes lies a beautiful story.

posts_with_comments.title: He collected the plastic trash on a daily basis.
posts_with_comments.body: He collected the plastic trash on a daily basis. It never seemed to end. Even if he cleaned the entire beach, more plastic would cover it the next day after the tide had come in. Although it was a futile effort that would never be done, he continued to pick up the trash each day.

posts_with_comments.title: It was so great to hear from you today
posts_with_comments.body: "It was so great to hear from you today and it was such weird timing," he said. "This is going to sound funny and a little strange, but you were in a dream I had just a couple of days ago. I'd love to get together and tell you about it if you're up for a cup of coffee," he continued, laying the trap he'd been planning for years.

comments.body: Hello, you seem truly charming in this as always.

posts_with_comments.title: Have you ever wondered about toes?
posts_with_comments.body: Why 10 toes and not 12. Why are some bigger than others? Some people can use their toes to pick up things while others can barely move them on command. Some toes are nice to look at while others are definitely not something you want to look at. Toes can be stubbed and make us scream. Toes help us balance and walk. 10 toes are just something to ponder.

comments.body: The most stunning thing I've seen today.

posts_with_comments.title: His parents continued to question him.
posts_with_comments.body: He didn't know what to say to them since they refused to believe the truth. He explained again and again, and they dismissed his explanation as a figment of his imagination. There was no way that grandpa, who had been dead for five years, could have told him where the treasure had been hidden. Of course, it didn't help that grandpa was roaring with laughter in the chair next to him as he tried to explain once again how he'd found it.

posts_with_comments.title: You know that tingly feeling you get on the back of your neck sometimes?
posts_with_comments.body: You know that tingly feeling you get on the back of your neck sometimes? I just got that feeling when talking with her. You know I don't believe in sixth senses, but there is something not right with her. I don't know how I know, but I just do.

comments.body: Your beauty is one of the things I like about you.
You are the light in the darkness.

posts_with_comments.title: Explain to me again why I shouldn't cheat?
posts_with_comments.body: "Explain to me again why I shouldn't cheat?" he asked. "All the others do and nobody ever gets punished for doing so. I should go about being happy losing to cheaters because I know that I don't? That's what you're telling me?"

posts_with_comments.title: A long black shadow slid across the pavement
posts_with_comments.body: A long black shadow slid across the pavement near their feet and the five Venusians, very much startled, looked overhead. They were barely in time to see the huge gray form of the carnivore before it vanished behind a sign atop a nearby building which bore the mystifying information "Pepsi-Cola."

comments.body: You're an incredibly stunning, a really pretty, beautiful woman.

posts_with_comments.title: The red line moved across the page.
posts_with_comments.body: The red line moved across the page. With each millimeter it advanced forward, something changed in the room. The actual change taking place was difficult to perceive, but the change was real. The red line continued relentlessly across the page and the room would never be the same.

posts_with_comments.title: The clowns had taken over. And yes, they were literally clowns.
posts_with_comments.body: The clowns had taken over. And yes, they were literally clowns. Over 100 had appeared out of a small VW bug that had been driven up to the bank. Now they were all inside and had taken it over.

comments.body: What terrific math skills you're showing!

posts_with_comments.title: The shoes had been there for as long as anyone could remember.
posts_with_comments.body: The shoes had been there for as long as anyone could remember. In fact, it was difficult for anyone to come up with a date they had first appeared. It had seemed they'd always been there and yet they seemed so out of place. Why nobody had removed them was a question that had been asked time and again, but while they all thought it, nobody had ever found the energy to actually do it.

posts_with_comments.title: Trees. It was something about the trees.
posts_with_comments.body: Trees. It was something about the trees. The way they swayed with the wind in unison. The way they shaded the area around them. The sounds of their leaves in the wind and the creaks from the branches as they sway, The trees were making a statement that I just couldn't understand.

posts_with_comments.title: Sometimes it's just better not to be seen.
posts_with_comments.body: Sometimes it's just better not to be seen. That's how Harry had always lived his life. He prided himself as being the fly on the wall and the fae that blended into the crowd. That's why he was so shocked that she noticed him.

comments.body: I can tell this is your best effort!

posts_with_comments.title: It was a concerning development that he couldn't get out of his mind.
posts_with_comments.body: He'd had many friends throughout his early years and had fond memories of playing with them, but he couldn't understand how it had all stopped. There was some point as he grew up that he played with each of his friends for the very last time, and he had no idea that it would be the last.

comments.body: Each time I see you, I get light from your eyes.

posts_with_comments.title: The towels had been hanging from the rod for years.
posts_with_comments.body: The towels had been hanging from the rod for years. They were stained and worn, and quite frankly, just plain ugly. Debra didn't want to touch them but she really didn't have a choice. It was important for her to see what was living within them.

comments.body: Well I think this is often my favorite posture of yours.

posts_with_comments.title: The headache wouldn't go away.
posts_with_comments.body: The headache wouldn't go away. She's taken medicine but even that didn't help. The monstrous throbbing in her head continued. She had this happen to her only once before in her life and she realized that only one thing could be happening.

comments.body: Here's to hope your day consists of bright traffic lights, the supermarket's quickest queue, and all the best ways to get you right back in my embrace.

posts_with_comments.title: The young man wanted a role model.
posts_with_comments.body: The young man wanted a role model. He looked long and hard in his youth, but that role model never materialized. His only choice was to embrace all the people in his life he didn't want to be like.

posts_with_comments.title: Debbie knew she was being selfish
posts_with_comments.body: Debbie knew she was being selfish and unreasonable. She understood why the others in the room were angry and frustrated with her and the way she was acting. In her eyes, it didn't really matter how they felt because she simply didn't care.

posts_with_comments.title: She tried to explain that love wasn't like pie.
posts_with_comments.body: She tried to explain that love wasn't like pie. There wasn't a set number of slices to be given out. There wasn't less to be given to one person if you wanted to give more to another. That after a set amount was given out it would all disappear. She tried to explain this, but it fell on deaf ears.

comments.body: I can tell you've been paying attention!
You look even more pretty without makeup.
You are true, beautiful and pure.

posts_with_comments.title: The house was located at the top of the hill
posts_with_comments.body: The house was located at the top of the hill at the end of a winding road. It wasn't obvious that the house was there, but everyone in town knew that it existed. They were just all too afraid to ever go and see it in person.

posts_with_comments.title: It seemed like it should have been so simple.
posts_with_comments.body: It seemed like it should have been so simple. There was nothing inherently difficult with getting the project done. It was simple and straightforward enough that even a child should have been able to complete it on time, but that wasn't the case. The deadline had arrived and the project remained unfinished.

comments.body: Your smile is fair enchanted and magnificent.
For a few reasons each cherish tune makes me think of you….

posts_with_comments.title: Balloons are pretty and come in different colors
posts_with_comments.body: Balloons are pretty and come in different colors, different shapes, different sizes, and they can even adjust sizes as needed. But don't make them too big or they might just pop, and then bye-bye balloon. It'll be gone and lost for the rest of mankind. They can serve a variety of purposes, from decorating to water balloon wars. You just have to use your head to think a little bit about what to do with them.

comments.body: You've made a lot of progress!
I get attracted to you when you try to make me a better person.

posts_with_comments.title: She looked at her student wondering if she could ever get through.
posts_with_comments.body: She looked at her student wondering if she could ever get through. "You need to learn to think for yourself," she wanted to tell him. "Your friends are holding you back and bringing you down." But she didn't because she knew his friends were all that he had and even if that meant a life of misery, he would never give them up.

posts_with_comments.title: He heard the crack echo in the late afternoon about a mile away.
posts_with_comments.body: He heard the crack echo in the late afternoon about a mile away. His heart started racing and he bolted into a full sprint. "It wasn't a gunshot, it wasn't a gunshot," he repeated under his breathlessness as he continued to sprint.
